quote-source: Donât Fall In Love With The Curious One (via crims0nlips)
quote-text:
Donât fall in love with a curious one.
They will want to know who you are, where you come from, what your family was like.
They will look through your photographs and read all of your poems. They will come over for dinner and speak to your mother about how their curiosity has taught them things of use to her. They will ask you to rant when youâre angry and cry when youâre hurt.
They will ask what that raised eyebrow meant. They will want to know your favorite food, your favorite color, you favorite person. They will ask why.
They will buy that camera you liked, pay attention to that band you love in case thereâs a show near by, they will get you the sweater you smiled at once. Theyâll learn to cook your favorite meals.
The curious people donât settle for your shell, they want the insides.
They want what makes you heavy, what makes you uneasy, what makes you scream
for joy, and anger, and heartbreak.
Their skin will turn into pages
that you learn to pour out your entire being in.
Donât fall in love with the curious one.
They wonât let a sigh go unexplained.
They will want to know what they did
Exactly what they did to make you love them.
Year, month, week, day.
âWhat time was it? What did I say? What did I do?
How did you feel?â
Donât fall in love with a curious one because Iâve been there.
They will unbutton your shirt
and read every scar
every mark
every curve.
They will dissect your every limb, every organ, every thought, every being.

âThereâs a curiosity in you that will move mountains some day
as effortlessly as youâve moved me for years.â
